description:
10 CANOES, 150 LANCES, 3 WIVES Australia - 2006 - 1h31 in VO - Carried out by Rolf De Heer, with Crusoe Kurddal, Jamie Dayindi, Gulpil Dalaithngu? In moved back times, in the North of Australia, Dayindi covets one of the three women of her elder brother, Ridjimaril, thus threatening the tribal law. In order to bring back Dayindi in the right way, the Minygululu old man tells him an ancestral legend of loves prohibited, removal, sorcery and revenge which turns badly. It is the indigenous actor of origin Peter Djigirr of the Yolngu tribe, a tribe which lives today ?per hour of the civilization?, which required of Rolf de Heer (the author of BAD SERVANT BOY BUBBY) to carry out this funny fable with the title in the form of inventory. A film which does not resemble any other, in which a facetious narrator - member of the tribe - us strolls from one history to another, between passed and present, stretches the account like making some last savour. This cordial voice will guide us in this account in the shape of Russian headstocks where it is a question of commonplace things, like stories of farts, too small sexes or shits which it is not to better let trail, but where one also discovers how the wars as well as ancestral habits like the ?makaratta are declared? or the art of the collection of goose eggs?
